707704f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 109th St.
707704f-a.text:
First Avenue, west side, north from and including 109th Street.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

715008f-a.title: Manhattan: 109th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
715008f-a.text:
409-411 East 109th Street, north side, east of First Avenue. No. 411 is a two-story frame shack from which grain is sold.
August 31, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

731612f-a.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731612f-a.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Parade, aarching north on First Avenue, between 109th and 110th Streets, showing the spectators in the houses and shops on the west side of the Avenue. Notice the three penitent women.marching barefoot.
July 16, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  2) A3  A: 415  EE
(2)
Parade, Mauching east on 111th Street, at and adjoining S.E. oorner of Second Avenue. Notice the picture-banner of St.
Nicholas of Savoy.
July 16, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.  . ICE ,2:
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  N1 1  E1  Ii. G. t e S
(3)
Parade, women and children bearing small towers of candles.
The street is unidentified.
July 16, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
